alert.note: Alert for Western Clay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 3:17PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Clay County through 400 PM EDT... At 317 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Camp Blanding, or 8 miles south of Middleburg, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Green Cove Springs, Middleburg, Kingsley, Camp Blanding, Penney Farms and Asbury Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. For boaters on or near the St Johns River or Intracoastal waterway, move to a safe shelter now! Do not be caught on or near the water. Gusty winds and choppy waves are likely. Make sure all on board are wearing life jackets.
